com.cloudera.director.spi.v1.provider

Interface Launcher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLauncher

    public interface Launcher

    Cloud provider plugin launcher.

    This class provides the entry point from Cloudera Director to the cloud provider plugin implementation. The plugin must be packaged as a single jar whose manifest includes the properties Cloudera-Director-Launcher-Class whose value is the fully-qualified name of a class which implements this interface and has a no-argument public constructor, and Cloudera-Director-SPI-Version, whose value is the supported SPI version (e.g. v1). Cloudera Director instantiates the class via reflection and invokes the initialize(File, HttpProxyParameters) method before requesting any providers.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(File configurationDirectory,
              HttpProxyParameters httpProxyParameters)
        Initializes the cloud provider plugin. The plugin is guaranteed read and execute access to the specified plugin-specific configuration directory to allow for additional filesystem configuration by the end user.
        Parameters:
        configurationDirectory - the configuration directory
        httpProxyParameters - the HTTP proxy parameters

      • getCloudProviderMetadata

        List<CloudProviderMetadata> getCloudProviderMetadata()
        Returns cloud provider metadata for all supported cloud providers.
        Returns:
        resource provider metadata for all supported cloud providers

      • createCloudProvider

        CloudProvider createCloudProvider(String cloudProviderId,
                                Configured configuration,
                                Locale locale)
        Returns the specified cloud provider, using the specified configuration.
        Parameters:
        cloudProviderId - the cloud provider ID, as returned by its metadata
        configuration - the configuration
        locale - the locale
        Returns:
        the specified cloud provider, using the specified configuration if it has not already been initialized

      • getLocalizationContext

        LocalizationContext getLocalizationContext(Locale locale)
        Returns the localization context for the specified locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale
        Returns:
        the localization context for the specified locale
